bibl.title: Letter from John J. Moran to Philip Showalter Hench, April 10, 1939

div1.p: Moran reports on his health and encloses a newspaper clipping for Hench about Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from John J. Moran to Philip Showalter Hench, April 10, 1939
div1.opener:
Havana, April 10, 1939.
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
MAYO CLINIC,
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Doctor:
div1.p:
On or about December 25th, 1938, I really thought
I was going to check in. That would have been a coincidence -
- you will recall that I was taken down with yellow fever on
December 25, 1900. I put myself into the hands of a stomach
specialist. Had a knawing pain for two solid weeks which
Cream of Bismuth (PDCo) had previously relieved, combined with
Schering-Kahlbaum's Nuetralon with Belladonna. The pain stayed
with me night and day. I have always slept “like a log” but
during that two weeks I could not sleep for more than an hour at
a time. My specialist put me immediately on a strictly milk
diet, with half teaspoonful doses of a powder composed of Vichy
Salts, Oxide of Magnesia and Bismuth Subnitrate. He allowed my
stomach to rest for four or five days and then made laboratory
tests of my gastric juice. I had a tube down my throat for
three hours and a half. Then an X-Ray test, the following day.
Since the first of the year, still on “diet” (not a milk diet
any more, of course) I have not felt the slightest discomfort
or pain and I now feel that I am on the way to full recovery.
Too long a story for a busy man like your good self to read, so
I will cut it off right here.

Some few months ago someone sent me the enclosed
clipping. Your United Press representative or service made
an excellent job of reporting. I do not think Kissinger was
correctly quoted, at that, but you will recall what my friend
in Washington wrote me. The latter was not a newspaper man
and he DID protest to Kissinger in person about the fake in-
formation given out in his name. Have been intending to send
this clipping to you for some time. Hope you received my
Christmas Card OK.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, John J. Moran. Address:
Same as shown in
previous letters.
Have you dropped the Reed-Finlay
matter altogether. If you have,
I am sorry. It should be cleared
up and by some member of the medical
profession. JJM
